docs.title: Welcome to My Research Page
docs.text:
Hi, I'm Kyle! I am a Physics MSc student at McGill University co-advised by Vicky Kaspi and Jason Hessels, and am a member of the CHIME/FRB collaboration. My research primarily focuses on FRB populations and astrostatistics. Feel free to reach out!

If you're like to learn more, you can find an introduction to my research, some info on some recent projects and some more info about me.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Kyle McGregor is an MSc student at McGill University, co-supervised by Vicky Kaspi and Jason Hessels.

docs.title: Astrophotography
docs.text: In my spare time I am an amateur astrophotographer! Here are some examples of my favorite captures.K

docs.title: Projects
docs.text:
Here are some projects that I am working on.

  • mapper is a python library I wrote to easily generate random points in various coordinate systems and cosmological distances.

docs.title: Research Interests
docs.text: I am broadly interested in Fast Radio Burst (FRB) populations and astrostatistics.

• Modeling Current and Future High-Cadence Surveys of Repeating FRBs, K. McGregor, D. R. Lorimer, Astrophysical Journal, 961, 10
  • A study of centaur (54598) Bienor from multiple stellar occultations and rotational light curves, Rizos et al., Astronomy and Astrophysics, 689, A82
• The Two Rings of (50000) Quaoar, Pereira et al, Astronomy and Astrophysics, 673, L4

• The effect of lactose intolerance on future lunar exploration. O'Brien et al., Nature 1234 2023
  • Is the Moon made of cheese? O'Brien et al., Nature 1233 2023
• On ignoring experts within your field and claim everything is Aliens. O'Brien et al, "Science" 2022
• "Got your nose", a worrying rise in nasal robbery, O'Brien et al, 1st grade show and tell, 1995

docs.title: Awesome Paper
docs.text:
Here is a brief summary of my awesome paper which is published here. In this paper I postulate if the Inertia of an object Depend Upon Its Energy Content? It is found that:

$$E = mc^2$$

Here is an interesting figure from this paper:

docs.title: Multiwavelength Paper
docs.text:
In this multiwavelength paper, I use data from VERITAS, Swift and CHIME, to study the equivalencies of sample galaxies when investigating instrumental systematic. Applying Keeler's theorem (see also) it can be shown that convergence is quickly obtained, requiring at minimum two additional sample galaxies.

Centered and resized image of the Coma Cluster (source ESA)
